etymologies: mid 18th century (in prosthetic (sense 2 of the adjective)): via late Latin prostheticus from Greek prosthesis: see prosthesis, -ic

definitions: denoting an artificial body part, such as a limb, a heart, or a breast implant

examples.text: he wears prosthetic legs because his own were amputated

definitions: denoting a material designed to alter a person's physical appearance temporarily

examples.text: an actor transformed by layers of prosthetic makeup

shortDefinitions: denoting material designed to alter a person's physical appearance

definitions: denoting a letter or syllable added at the beginning of a word, as in Spanish escuela derived from Latin scola.
shortDefinitions: denoting letter or syllable added at beginning of word

definitions: an artificial body part; a prosthesis

examples.text: three charities working there make prosthetics and help amputees to walk

definitions: the making and fitting of artificial body parts.
shortDefinitions: branch of surgery concerned with making and fitting of artificial body parts

definitions: an artificial feature or piece of flexible material applied to a person's face or body to change their appearance temporarily

examples.text: he plays all the parts, using various wigs and prosthetics
my prosthetic was made by a special effects makeup artist

shortDefinitions: artificial feature applied to an actor's face to transform their appearance
